data.title: The Classic EastEnders episode guide (updated weekly) - Page 8
data.meta_description: Ted and Peggy most definitely didn't know each other, the retcon was utterly stupid :neutral:
data.text:
Monday 16 November 2020 - Episode 1183 (Tue 12 September 1995) watched by 13.73m / 17.75m.

written by: Lisselle Kayla

Dr Legg has a busy day as a mystery bug sweeps through Albert Square. Phil gets an invitation from Grant but is worried about Kathy's reaction, and Robbie falls in love.

Episode 1184 ( Thu 14 September 1995) watched by 14.04m / 18.54m.

written by: Chris Reason

Ruth and Mark wait anxiously for news, while Bianca's family gather around her bedside - with some surprising results. Robbie's lust gets the better of him when he launches himself at the girl of his dreams. Michelle receives some distressing news at work - but will her boss be sympathetic?

Tuesday 17 November 2020 - Episode 1185 (Mon 18 September 1995) watched by 12.98m / 15.12m.

written by: Richard Zajdlic

Michelle has a surprise at work, while Nigel braves out Debbie's inquest. Robbie looks forward to his first date.

Episode 1186 (Tue 19 September 1995) watched by 13.7m / 16.89m.

written by: Richard Zajdlic

Nigel has an unexpected encounter while David can't resist the lure of the chippy. Tina tries to put as much distance as possible between her and Robbie.

Wednesday 18 November 2020 - Episode 1187 (Thu 21 September 1995) watched by 13.7m / 17.59m.

written by: Alison Fisher

Ricky lends Robbie a sympathetic ear, Gita and Sharmilla wave goodbye to Sanjay, and it seems as if the Jacksons are on the up. But there is more bad news for Michelle.

Episode 1188 (Mon 25 September 1995) watched by 13.18m / 17.29m.

written by: Chris Reason

Kathy is slowly facing up to her situation, but an evening with Pat awakens old memories. Michelle opens the door to an unexpected visitor - and an unexpected offer. Sam loses out to Cindy, while Ian picks up a few tips on telephone technique from David, and nearly blows his cover.

Thursday 19 November 2020 - Episode 1189 (Tue 26 September 1995) watched by 15.12m / 19.92m.

written by: Chris Reason

Michelle is thrown off balance by a new proposal from an old flame. Pat goes green when Carol starts talking colour schemes. And David and Cindy are almost caught in the act.

Episode 1190 (Thu 28 September 1995) watched by 14.27m / 20.31m.

written by: Jeff Povey

Grant teaches Sam a lesson about her love life, while Kathy wants an opportunity to confide in Ted. David and Ian plan the perfect scam for Quiz Night but with Cindy's help, matters soon get out of hand. Ricky and Alan make a mockery of Pat and Carol's DIY plans.

Friday 20 November 2020 - Episode 1191 (Mon 2 October 1995) watched by 13.44m / 16m.

written by: Jeff Povey

Sam's plans for revenge on David go badly wrong, while Grant's behaviour is misinterpreted by Ruth with devastating consequences. Cindy and David embark on yet another dangerous liaison.

Episode 1192 (Tue 3 October 1995) watched by 15.63m / 19.04m.

written by: Tony McHale

Passions rise as Michelle confronts Grant in the Vic and the past comes back to haunt them with surprising consequences. Meanwhile, in an attempt to ensure that her future with David is more than a pipe dream, Cindy gets him to face up to some home truths.

3

Monday 23 November 2020 - Episode 1193 (Thu 5 October 1995) watched by 15.6m / 19.41m.

written by: Julie Wassmer

Cindy is forced to do some quick thinking, while Michelle has unfinished business with Grant. Arthur has a welcome surprise when he and Pauline return home. Kathy finds that letting Phil in on her little secret could prove harder than she'd imagined.

Episode 1194 ( Mon 9 October 1995) watched by 13.82m / 16.36m.

written by: Jonathan David

The past catches up with Ted. Pauline crosses swords with Michelle, while Roy is out for Barry's blood.

Tuesday 24 November 2020 - Episode 1195 (Tue 10 October 1995) watched by 15.18m / 18.62m.

written by: Joanne Maguire

Cindy and David are playing with fire. Kathy is at breaking point. Michelle sees a way out.

Episode 1196 (Thu 12 October 1995) watched by 16.02m / 20.01m.

written by: Joanne Maguire

Bianca gears up for her driving test and a dodgy scheme of David's goes awry. It's a day of surprises for Ian when he gets a shock in the chippy. Michelle has an unwanted visitor who throws her feelings into turmoil.

Wednesday 25 November 2020 - Episode 1197 (Mon 16 October 1995) watched by 14.28m / 17.64m.

written by: Gillian Richmond

Kathy can't believe what she has learnt about Ted. Michelle gets a letter and finds her plans for the future thrown wide open.

Episode 1198 (Tue 17 October 1995) watched by 15.33m / 19.15m.

written by: Gillian Richmond

How will Pauline and Arthur react to Michelle's decision? Kathy wants to see Ted, even if it is only to set the record straight.

Thursday 26 November 2020 - Episode 1199 (Thu 19 October 1995) watched by 15,98m / 20.63m.

written by: Simon Ashdown (the first of many!)

Arthur finds himself caught between the stubborn pairing of Pauline and Michelle, while Ted gains a home but loses an old friend. Roy diverts Pat from her decorating. Ian, still obsessed with the Queen Vic quiz night, aims to slaughter the opposition.

Episode 1200 (Mon 23 October 1995) watched by 15.18m / 18.17m.

written by: Tony McHale

Robbie's quiet night in goes wrong. Michelle is forced to think twice about her plans, while Ian prepares for the pub quiz showdown.

Friday 27 November 2020 - Episode 1201 (Tue 24 October 1995) watched by 16.69m / 20.21m.

written by: Tony McHale

Arthur and Mark try to make peace in the Fowler family. Michelle arranges a meeting with an old adversary, while David feels fenced in by Cindy.

Episode 1202 (Thu 26 October 1995) watched by 16.32m / 20.31m. *Last appearance of Susan Tully*

written by: Tony McHale

Michelle has some peacemaking with Pauline to attend to and some explaining to do to Grant. Michelle's choices will affect the rest of her life, while Arthur decides that Pauline is best left untold.

1

Monday 30 November 2020 - Episode 1203 (Mon 30 October 1995) watched by 14.22m / 17.02m.

written by: Scott Cherry

Arthur finds that he and Mark share a secret, but Pauline is kept in the dark. Gita mixes business with pleasure, Bianca is in the right place at the right time, and Cindy is left out in the cold.

Episode 1204 ( Tue 31 October 1995) watched by 15.12m / 18.8m.

written by: Susan Boyd

Martin gives Pauline the slip, sparking off a Halloween panic. Sam falls foul of Grant, Tiffany loses her job - and Nigel tries his hand at pulling pints.

Tuesday 1 December 2020 - Episode 1205 (Thu 2 November 1995) watched by 15.89m / 20.18m.

written by: Susan Boyd

Pauline sees her children in a different light, while Arthur receives some threatening post. Nigel can't bring himself to reveal the truth to Clare, and Ian pays Cindy an unwelcome compliment. Tiffany finds she is in a bargaining position with Grant.

Episode 1206 (Mon 6 November 1995) watched by 13.94m / 17.18m.

written by: Len Collin

The meeting with his solicitor spells disaster for Nigel and Grant make a promise he probably won't be able to keep.

Wednesday 2 December 2020 - Episode 1207 (Tue 7 November 1995) watched by 15.54m / 19.51m.

written by: Len Collin

Trouble brews between the Mitchell brothers when Phil tells Grant that he's going to become a father. Arthur is presented with a cheque.

Episode 1208 (Thu 9 November 1995) watched by 16.23m / 20.65m.

written by: David Joss Buckley

Arthur has to pass on some unwelcome news about Michelle to Pauline. Alan almost comes to blows with a newcomer to the Square. Robbie and Grant await the birth of Freida's puppies. Nigel puts on a brave face for Clare. Sonia is playing the trumpet.

Thursday 3 December 2020 - Episode 1209 (Mon 13 November 1995) watched by 14.31m / 17.11m.

written by: Barrie Shore

Pauline rounds on Arthur and Mark, Tiffany makes Ricky's life hell, and Nigel gets ready for court.

Episode 1210 (Tue 14 November 1995) watched by 16.21m / 20.21m.

written by: Barry McCarthy

Nigel and Liam fight for custody of Clare, while Bianca puts Ricky on the spot.

Friday 4 December 2020 - Episode 1211 (Thu 16 November 1995) watched by 16.24m / 20.85m.

written by: Tony Jordan

Cindy demands some straight answers from David - and gets more than she bargained for. Kathy and Phil have an announcement to make, but it doesn't quite go according to plan. Mark's concern for Gita's booming business falls on deaf ears. And Nigel starts to plan the rest of his life.

Episode 1212 (Mon 20 November 1995) watched by 14.32m / 17.24m.

written by: Annie Wood

Peggy is delighted about Kathy's pregnancy, but Cindy dreads Ian finding out. Meanwhile, Arthur receives congratulations all round as his Flowering Wilderness campaign nears completion.

2

Monday 7 December 2020 - Episode 1213 (Tue 21 November 1995) watched by 15.64m / 19.34m.

written by: Annie Wood

Arthur and Willy battle with the authorities, Roy offers Pat a solution to both their problems, and Ted teaches Tony a lesson.

Episode 1214 ( Thu 23 November 1995) watched by 15.3m / 19.48m.

written by: Alan McDonald

Pat has some important news for her family. Peggy's advice is driving Kathy up the wall. Felix is settling into the square. Cindy gives David her parting shot.

Tuesday 8 December 2020 - Episode 1215 (Mon 27 November 1995) watched by 13.28m / 16.06m.

written by: Mark Davies Markham

Phil is left holding the babies, with a little help from Grant. Ricky is unsettled by Frank's belongings being moved out and Pat is thrown off balance by an unexpected letter. Meanwhile it's drinks all round as Ted and Roy celebrate their move into the Square.

Episode 1216 (Tue 28 November 1995) watched by 15.34m / 18.95m.

written by: Lisselle Kayla

Ricky leaves for Paris, Well'ard and Sonia share supper, and a troubled Pat goes walkabout. Meanwhile, Arthur tries to burn away his worries on a bonfire.

Wednesday 9 December 2020 - Episode 1217 (Thu 30 November 1995) watched by 15.04m / 19.34m.

written by: Tony Jordan

Pat celebrates Roy's move by playing hostess with the mostest. Sarah stuns her father when she reveals how she has spent her afternoon. Arthur once again finds the odds stacked against him on a return visit to the police station. Robbie decides to expand his business empire. Phil makes Nigel an interesting offer.

Episode 1218 (Mon 4 December 1995) watched by 14.05m / 16.21m.

written by: Chris Reason

Arthur hides at the allotment before telling Pauline about his arrest. Robbie dumps his newspapers and says he has been mugged. Guppy takes Gita to lunch.

Thursday 10 December 2020 - Episode 1219 (Tue 5 December 1995) watched by 15.93m / 18.98m.

written by: Chris Reason

The Fowlers rally round Arthur but things are made worse by a muck-raking journalist. Robbie discovers some Christmas tips too late.

Episode 1220 (Thu 7 December 1995) watched by 16.5m / 20.31m.

written by: Chris Reason

Mark tries to defend his family's name. Carol wants Robbie to recover his losses. Grant and Phil decide it's time for Nigel to make a career change.

Friday 11 December 2020 - Episode 1221 (Mon 11 December 1995) watched by 13.77m / 16.34m. **25 years ago to the day**

written by: Nicholas Hicks-Beach

A nasty shock awaits Ricky on his return from Paris, Cindy is back with a vengeance and Mark undertakes some private investigations. Pauline wonders if Arthur might be losing his grip.

Episode 1222 (Tue 12 December 1995) watched by 14.75m / 17.86m.

written by: David Richard-Fox

Roy is in a festive mood while Pat is haunted by Christmas Past. Gita gets ready for her hot date. Mark is on a dangerous mission for justice with Ruth firmly by his side.

8 episodes left from 1995.

2
